subject_terms_3: Painting Force 136 (Guerilla movement) Tan, Chong Tee 1942-1945 Japanese occupation
physical_appearance: This is a scroll painting depicting the battle at River Jian. It shows a mountainous landscape, with a water body flowing through the center of the painting. Along the bottom, there are images of troops on military vehicles, and scenes from the frontline battlefields. There is an inscription at the top right of the painting. The painting is presented on a long vertical scroll.
sgcool_label_text:
This painting depicts the battle at River Jian and.is part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.
